name: Transformer Upgrade Rebate Program
description: Up to $10,000 for single-family homes or $100,000 for schools/non-profits/multi-family for infrastructure upgrades related to EV charger installation
fullDescription: City of Palo Alto Utilities helps offset the cost of electrical infrastructure upgrades needed for EV charger installations, making charging infrastructure more affordable.
whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $10,000 for single-family homes
- Up to $100,000 for multi-family/schools/non-profits
- Covers utility service connection fees
- Covers substructure work costs
- Enables higher-capacity EV charging
- Reduces infrastructure barriers
howToGetIt:
1. Must be a City of Palo Alto Utilities customer
2. Plan EV charger installation requiring upgrades
3. Apply through CPAU before work begins
4. Get project scope approved
5. Complete infrastructure upgrades
6. Submit documentation for rebate
keywords: Palo Alto, CPAU, transformer upgrade, $10000, $100000, EV charger, electrical infrastructure, service connection
